page.title: 15LARGE HOUSES-LT.GAD. AREA
page.content: Stocks House built in 1176 was bought by Mr.Lownes in 1972 and was opened as a Country Club in 1983.The Club gives members a relaxing country retreat and has the amenities of a heated outdoor Swimming pool,Tennis courts,Squash courts,Stables,Clay Pigeon shooting, Jacuzzi,Sauna ect.It costs around Â£200 subcription annually and for two nights Â£125 with all meals and use of amenities. John O'Gaddesden House is the oldest in the village built in 1280 for John who was a physician to Edward 1 & 2. The Black Prince is reputed to have stayed.The house has close set brown timbering,small, narrow,red bricks in the chimneys and whitewash over the brick nogging on the outside.The grounds are over an acre.The house has been used as a village reading room. The present owners are Mr.v Mrs.Allen.
